meanings.definition: Relating to the study of past geographical features.
meanings.sent1: The paleogeographically significant fossils were found in the ancient rock layers.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use paleogeographically data to understand how the Earth's surface has changed over time.
meanings.sent3: The paleogeographically curious dinosaur seemed lost in the modern world.
meanings.sent4: Her mind wandered paleogeographically, exploring the landscapes of history.
meanings.sent5: The paleogeographically colored map showed the ancient continents in vibrant hues.

meanings.definition: In a manner pertaining to the geography of ancient times.
meanings.sent1: The explorer traveled paleogeographically, imagining the world as it once was.
meanings.sent2: The map was drawn paleogeographically to depict how the landmasses looked in the past.
meanings.sent3: She danced paleogeographically, mimicking the movements of ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts raced paleogeographically, envisioning the landscapes of bygone eras.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted paleogeographically, capturing the essence of ancient geography.
